articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Residents in several neighbourhoods reported small arms fire and some loud explosions, particularly close to the airport.
articles.title: Rwanda-backed Congo rebels face pockets of resistance after entering Goma

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Palestinians have waited for two days at roadblocks.
articles.title: Hamas to release Israeli hostage Yehud, two others before Friday, Israel to allow Gazans to return home north

articles.author: Sergiy Karazy, Yurii Kovalenko
articles.description: Six months ago, doctors were performing an operation at Ukraine's Center for Pediatric Cardiology and Cardiac Surgery when a missile struck the adjacent building inside the Kyiv compound of Ukraine's biggest children's hospital.
articles.title: Ukrainian doctors save lives at children's heart surgery center relocated after missile attack

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will soon sign executive orders removing diversity, equity and inclusion from the military, reinstating thousands of troops who were kicked out for refusing COVID-19 vaccines during the pandemic, and building an air defense system for the United States, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday.
articles.title: Trump to take aim at DEI, COVID expulsions in military, Hegseth says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine soldiers will train on the U.S. military's intermediate range missile system during unilateral army drills next month as part of preparations for bigger exercises with U.S. counterparts, a military official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Philippine soldiers to train on US Typhon missile system

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: Britain and the European Union go to court for the first time on Tuesday to resolve a dispute over post-Brexit fishing rights, a case that could complicate Britain's planned "reset" of relations with the bloc.
articles.title: Britain and EU face off in court over post-Brexit fishing rights

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Italian navy ship carrying 49 migrants picked up in international waters arrived in Albania on Tuesday, amid a new attempt by Italy to push ahead with a legally contested plan to relocate migrants to the neighbouring country.
articles.title: Italian ship carrying migrants picked up offshore reaches Albania

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: One hospital received over 100 patients within 24 hours with head and chest wounds from mortar and shrapnel.
articles.title: Goma hospitals overwhelmed with wounded, dead bodies in the streets, UN agencies say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Overnight Russian air attacks wounded eight people, set a private business on fire and damaged residential buildings around Ukraine, local officials said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russian drone attacks injure eight, damage residences, Ukraine officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump plans to impose tariffs on imported computer chips, pharmaceuticals and steel, he said on Monday, to push companies to manufacture more in the United States.
articles.title: Trump tariffs on chips and drugs would hit U.S. allies in Asia
